title: Persipura Jayapura
text:
Persatuan Sepakbola Indonesia Jayapura, or Persipura, is an Indonesian <a href="association%20football">football</a> club based in <a href="Jayapura">Jayapura</a>, <a href="Papua%20%28province%29">Papua</a>. The club was founded in 1963 and currently competes in the <a href="Liga%201%20%28Indonesia%29">Liga 1</a>. Persipura plays their home matches in <a href="Mandala%20Stadium">Mandala Stadium</a>. Persipura is one of the giants of modern football in Indonesia with various league and tournament titles. Persipura is also known as the producer of great footballers from the land of Papua such as <a href="Rully%20Nere">Rully Nere</a>, <a href="Jack%20Komboy">Jack Komboy</a>, <a href="Eduard%20Ivakdalam">Eduard Ivakdalam</a>, <a href="Boaz%20Solossa">Boaz Solossa</a>, <a href="Ian%20Louis%20Kabes">Ian Louis Kabes</a> and <a href="Imanuel%20Wanggai">Imanuel Wanggai</a>. They are known for playing style relying on the abilities of individual players.
History.
Foundation and early years (1963–1994).
Persipura's history is mysterious. The club's administrators cannot fully make sure that the club was founded in 1963, since there are also proof that suggests the club might have been founded in 1965, 1962, or even 1950. Other than that, the administrators also cannot fully make sure Persipura's original name.
The early years were not filled with a lot of achievements. They only managed to win the Perserikatan First Division two times in 1979 and 1993, other than that they were runners-up in the 1980 <a href="Perserikatan">Perserikatan</a> season.
Modern era and recent history (1994–present).
Their first achievement in the modern era is by winning the <a href="2005%20Liga%20Indonesia%20Premier%20Division">2005 Liga Indonesia Premier Division</a> under coach <a href="Rahmad%20Darmawan">Rahmad Darmawan</a>. PT. Persipura Papua was established to fulfill the requirement to compete in the <a href="Indonesia%20Super%20League">Indonesia Super League</a>.
Persipura dominated Indonesian football under the control of Brazilian coach <a href="Jacksen%20F.%20Tiago">Jacksen F. Tiago</a> by winning the <a href="Indonesia%20Super%20League">Indonesia Super League</a> (present: <a href="Liga%201%20%28Indonesia%29">Liga 1</a>) in <a href="2008-09%20Indonesia%20Super%20League">2009</a>, <a href="2010-11%20Indonesia%20Super%20League">2011</a> and <a href="2013%20Indonesia%20Super%20League">2013</a>.
Stadium.
Persipura uses Mandala Stadium as their home ground. Located on Dock V Jayapura and Facing a beautiful view of Humboldt Bay, making Mandala Stadium as one of the Beautiful stadium view in South East Asia.
Supporters.
Their supporters are called Persipura Mania. They also have hardline fans or <a href="ultras">ultras</a> namely The Comen's and Black Pearl Curva Nord.
